content:
Has anyone else had this submodule error when running x.py?

Updating only changed submodules
Updating submodule src/tools/miri
Submodule path 'src/tools/miri': checked out 'c8f51fc5a772a125f3b3ad7fe46609a4638ca509'
Updating submodule library/stdarch
remote: Enumerating objects: 152, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (152/152), done.
remote: Total 227 (delta 151), reused 151 (delta 151), pack-reused 75
Receiving objects: 100% (227/227), 288.94 KiB | 2.12 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (170/170), completed with 67 local objects.
From https://github.com/rust-lang/stdarch
   027680f3..777efaf5  master     -> origin/master
error: Your local changes to the following files would be overwritten by checkout:
    crates/core_arch/src/mod.rs
Please commit your changes or stash them before you switch branches.
Aborting

I've had it multiple times. It can be fixed with git submodule update --force library/stdarch, but it's weird because I didn't change stdarch at all!
Is your editor erasing white-spaces or similar?
